New Records: Corey Seager became just the fourth player to win multiple World Series MVPs.
Key Match Events: Corey Seager broke up Zac Gallen's no-hit bid with a leadoff single in the seventh inning.
Seager scored the deciding run on a single from Mitch Garver.
Seager hit a two-run homer off closer Paul Sewald in Game 1.
Adolis García hit a walk-off homer in the 11th inning of Game 1.
Seager hit a two-run homer in the third inning of Game 3.
Post-Match Reflections: Corey Seager was named MVP of the 2023 World Series after Texas' 5-0 Game 5 win over the Arizona Diamondbacks.
Seager's performance included six hits, three homers, six RBIs, and three walks over the five games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Texas Rangers won their first World Series championship in franchise history by defeating the Arizona Diamondbacks 4-1 in the series.
Seager joined Hall of Famers Sandy Koufax, Bob Gibson, and Reggie Jackson as players with multiple World Series MVPs.
